text: To all people complaining about unoriginal movies based off of books or older movies, here's a fun fact: About 90 percent of Disney's animated films are based off of some literary work. It's been a thing for a while, its not a new fad or anything. And if you want a remake to be scene for scene what the original was, go watch the 1998 version of Psycho. Spoiler alert: its not a good film. Shot for shot remakes are a bad idea in general because that is unoriginal on the director's part. That's why remakes/reboots like this can and should make changes so its different enough to stand on its own. Complain all you want, I'm just venting what I think. The 1959 film is one of my favorite movies of all time, and because of that I'm excited for this remake. You're entitled to your own opinions, but you really shouldn't judge a movie based on its premise or trailer because they can only show so much of what the movie has to offer. See it first when it comes out, then complain all you want.
